title: Validating user input with conditionals: digits, ranges, and safe defaults
content:
Conditionals are often used to keep programs safe and predictable by validating input before using it.

---
## 1) Check if a string looks like a whole number

```python
raw = "42"

if raw.isdigit():
    n = int(raw)
    print("number", n)
else:
    print("not a whole number")
```

---
## 2) Range checking

```python
age = 20

if age < 0:
    print("invalid")
elif age < 13:
    print("child")
elif age < 20:
    print("teen")
else:
    print("adult")
```

---
## 3) Handling optional values (None checks)

```python
value = None

if value is None:
    print("missing")
else:
    print("got", value)
```

---
## 4) A balanced mini script: parse and respond

```python
text = " 7 "
text = text.strip()

if not text.isdigit():
    print("please enter digits")
else:
    n = int(text)
    if n % 2 == 0:
        print("even")
    else:
        print("odd")

    if n >= 10:
        print("two digits or more")
    else:
        print("single digit")
```
